verses.plain: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

tokens.t: Doth not wisdom cry? and understanding put forth her voice?

verses.plain: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

tokens.t: She standeth in the top of high places, by the way in the places of the paths.

verses.plain: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

tokens.t: She crieth at the gates, at the entry of the city, at the coming in at the doors.

verses.plain: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice is to the sons of man.

tokens.t: Unto you, O men, I call; and my voice
to the sons of man.

verses.plain: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

tokens.t: O ye simple, understand wisdom: and, ye fools, be ye of an understanding heart.

verses.plain: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips shall be right things.

tokens.t: Hear; for I will speak of excellent things; and the opening of my lips
right things.

verses.plain: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

tokens.t: For my mouth shall speak truth; and wickedness
an abomination to my lips.

verses.plain: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness; there is nothing froward or perverse in them.

tokens.t: All the words of my mouth
in righteousness;
nothing froward or perverse in them.

verses.plain: They are all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

tokens.t: They
all plain to him that understandeth, and right to them that find knowledge.

verses.plain: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

tokens.t: Receive my instruction, and not silver; and knowledge rather than choice gold.

verses.plain: For wisdom is better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

tokens.t: For wisdom
better than rubies; and all the things that may be desired are not to be compared to it.

verses.plain: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

tokens.t: I wisdom dwell with prudence, and find out knowledge of witty inventions.

verses.plain: The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

tokens.t: The fear of the
to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

verses.plain: Counsel is mine, and sound wisdom: I am understanding; I have strength.

tokens.t: Counsel
mine, and sound wisdom: I
understanding; I have strength.

verses.plain: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

tokens.t: By me kings reign, and princes decree justice.

verses.plain: By me princes rule, and nobles, even all the judges of the earth.

tokens.t: By me princes rule, and nobles,
all the judges of the earth.

verses.plain: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

tokens.t: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early shall find me.

verses.plain: Riches and honour are with me; yea, durable riches and righteousness.

tokens.t: Riches and honour
with me;
, durable riches and righteousness.

verses.plain: My fruit is better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

tokens.t: My fruit
better than gold, yea, than fine gold; and my revenue than choice silver.

verses.plain: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

tokens.t: I lead in the way of righteousness, in the midst of the paths of judgment:

verses.plain: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

tokens.t: That I may cause those that love me to inherit substance; and I will fill their treasures.

verses.plain: The LORD possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

tokens.t: The
possessed me in the beginning of his way, before his works of old.

verses.plain: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

tokens.t: I was set up from everlasting, from the beginning, or ever the earth was.

verses.plain: When there were no depths, I was brought forth; when there were no fountains abounding with water.

tokens.t: When
no depths, I was brought forth; when
no fountains abounding with water.

verses.plain: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

tokens.t: Before the mountains were settled, before the hills was I brought forth:

verses.plain: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

tokens.t: While as yet he had not made the earth, nor the fields, nor the highest part of the dust of the world.

verses.plain: When he prepared the heavens, I was there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

tokens.t: When he prepared the heavens, I
there: when he set a compass upon the face of the depth:

verses.plain: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

tokens.t: When he established the clouds above: when he strengthened the fountains of the deep:

verses.plain: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

tokens.t: When he gave to the sea his decree, that the waters should not pass his commandment: when he appointed the foundations of the earth:

verses.plain: Then I was by him, as one brought up with him: and I was daily his delight, rejoicing always before him;

tokens.t: Then I was by him,
one brought up
and I was daily
delight, rejoicing always before him;

verses.plain: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights were with the sons of men.

tokens.t: Rejoicing in the habitable part of his earth; and my delights
with the sons of men.

verses.plain: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed are they that keep my ways.

tokens.t: Now therefore hearken unto me, O ye children: for blessed
keep my ways.

verses.plain: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

tokens.t: Hear instruction, and be wise, and refuse it not.

verses.plain: Blessed is the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

tokens.t: Blessed
the man that heareth me, watching daily at my gates, waiting at the posts of my doors.

verses.plain: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the LORD.

tokens.t: For whoso findeth me findeth life, and shall obtain favour of the

verses.plain: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

tokens.t: But he that sinneth against me wrongeth his own soul: all they that hate me love death.

footnotes.text: an…: Heb. the abomination of my lips
the highest…: or, the chief part
